intro: Trachymene villosa, commonly known as hairy false Solomon's seal, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, with small white or pale purple flowers arranged in clusters. It blooms from late winter to early spring, and its fruits are small, dry capsules that release seeds when mature. Trachymene villosa is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest floors and rocky outcrops.
